intro: Cladochaeta caspica, commonly known as the Caspian cladochaeta, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are often succulent, helping it retain moisture in its harsh environment. Cladochaeta caspica is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations and limited distribution.
